channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Le téléobjectif du Galaxy S26 Ultra a changé, mais pas forcément en mieux
item.description: Samsung n'a pas réellement changé le hardware des capteurs photo des Galaxy S depuis des années. Sur le S26 Ultra, il y a pourtant une nouveauté. Sauf qu'elle ne va pas plaire à tout le monde.

item.title: NASA overhauls Artemis program, delaying Moon landing to 2028
item.description: NASA is making major changes to its Artemis Moon program. On Friday, Administrator Jared Isaacman announced the space agency would carry out an additional flight in 2027 to test commercial lunar landers from SpaceX and/or Blue Origin. The new mission will take the place of Artemis 3, which previously would have seen NASA attempt to land on the Moon for the first time since 1972. The flight will also see the agency test a new spacesuit made by Axiom Space. As part of the new plan, the redesigned Artemis 3 mission will give NASA the chance to test at least one lander in the relative safety of...

item.title: The Pentagon Wants X-Ray Vision to Spot Hidden Threats From 3,280 Feet
item.description: The futuristic tech, funded by DARPA, would allow the U.S. military to preemptively detect danger from a remarkably long distance.

item.title: Best Buy is clearing out OLED TVs ahead of 2026 releases — here are 7 deals I’d recommend without hesitation
item.description: Best Buy is offering its lowest price yet on OLED TVs as it makes room for new 2026 models, and I'm rounding up the 7 best deals that I recommend.

item.title: Samsung Might Not Make Another Galaxy Z TriFold Anytime Soon
item.description: Or another ultra-thin phone, either.

item.description: It's almost spring, and there are plenty of enticing new genre titles on the way.

item.title: À peine sortis les écouteurs Samsung Galaxy Buds 4 sont déjà en promo, une vraie opération séduction
item.description: Ils sont sur le marché depuis le 25 février 2026 et pourtant Amazon propose déjà 30 euros de moins sur les Samsung Galaxy Buds 4 qui passent de 179,99 euros à 149,99 euros.

item.title: Employees at Google and OpenAI support Anthropic’s Pentagon stand in open letter
item.description: While Anthropic has an existing partnership with the Pentagon, the AI company has remained firm that its technology not be used for mass domestic surveillance or fully autonomous weaponry.

item.title: Xiaomi nous prépare une surprise électrique pour le MWC : voici ce que l’on sait
item.description: À quelques heures de l'ouverture du MWC de Barcelone, Xiaomi vient d'annoncer qu'un "one more thing" sera dévoilé lors de sa conférence. Le teaser mystérieux cacherait le concept d'une voiture électrique ultra performante, créée avec le jeu vidéo Gran Turismo.

item.title: Plot twist — Netflix ditches Warner Bros deal as insiders call imminent Paramount takeover a ‘gut punch’
item.description: Netflix has decided to concede to Paramount in the battle for Warner Bros. Discovery.

item.title: Galaxy S26 Ultra : Samsung tente d’expliquer un étonnant retour en arrière
item.description: Le Galaxy S26 Ultra abandonne le cadre en titane pourtant si plébiscité sur ses prédécesseurs et revient au bon vieil aluminium. Voici comment Samsung explique cela.

item.title: We don’t have to have unsupervised killer robots
item.description: It's the day of the Pentagon's looming ultimatum for Anthropic: allow the US military unchecked access to its technology, including for mass surveillance and fully autonomous lethal weapons, or potentially be designated a "supply chain risk" and potentially lose hundreds of billions of dollars in contracts. Amid the intensifying public statements and threats, tech workers […]...

item.title: Jack Dorsey’s Block Cut Half Its Staff, and He Says Other Tech Firms Will Follow Soon
item.description: Dorsey claimed that AI made the layoffs inevitable but later admitted he over-hired during covid.

item.title: Wall Street Has AI Psychosis
item.description: A “thought experiment” about the impacts of AI sent stocks tumbling earlier this week. It’s probably going to keep happening.

item.title: 'It's nice to see another element of the show': Bridgerton star on why that brutal season 4 part 2 death needed to happen
item.description: Nobody should have to die in a Netflix romantic drama, but especially not in Bridgerton season 4 part 2. Now it's happened, one star still thinks it was the right decision.

item.title: CISA replaces acting director after a bumbling year on the job
item.description: The U.S. cybersecurity agency's acting director Madhu Gottumukkala will be replaced, after a year of cuts, layoffs, and staff reassignments, and allegations of security lapses and claims he struggled to lead the agency.

item.title: Un tsunami va frapper le marché du smartphone cette année
item.description: Plus dure sera la chute sur le marché du smartphone. La fringale de mémoire des grands acteurs de l'IA va faire mal aux constructeurs de téléphones, selon une nouvelle étude qui prévoit des livraisons en contraction de quasiment 13 % cette année.

item.title: Celebrate Pokémon’s 30th anniversary with this Game Boy-shaped music player
item.description: Pokémon celebrates its 30th anniversary today, and as you’d expect, Nintendo and The Pokémon Company are cranking up the nostalgia in every possible way. In addition to re-releasing the Game Boy Advance remakes of Pokémon Red and Blue on Nintendo Switch Online, they’re also selling us a Game Boy-shaped portable Pokémon jukebox. Officially titled the Pokémon Game Music Collection, the little music player is palm-sized and can be loaded up with 45 different cartridges, each featuring a different melody or sound effect from the original games' soundtrack. The device was announced by longtime seri...

item.title: Get the 65-inch Samsung The Frame Pro for $600 less at Amazon
item.description: As of Feb. 27, you can get the 65-inch Samsung The Frame Pro LED Smart TV (LS03FW, 2025) for $1,497.99, down from $2,097.99, at Amazon.

item.title: The US military reportedly shot down a CBP drone with a laser
item.description: The US military mistakenly shot down a drone belonging to Customs and Border Protection near the Mexican border in Fort Hancock, Texas, according to reports from Reuters and The New York Times. The Thursday incident reportedly led the Federal Aviation Administration to close the airspace where the military fired the anti-drone laser. This marks the […]...

item.title: Pokémon turns 30: What’s behind the media franchise’s enduring appeal?
item.description: Heather Cole, who teaches game design at West Virginia University says Pokémon offers a masterclass in character design. Benson Lu’s life revolves around Pokémon.The 26-year-old has played the mobile game Pokémon Go every day for a decade, watches the animated show every week, goes to the local card shop in his Los Angeles suburb to play the brand’s trading card game every week, and has a whopping collection of cards worth more than $70,000.“I don’t remember when was the last day I did not think about Pokémon at all,” he said.In the 30 years since Pokémon debuted in Japan with the 1996 release...

item.description: Best Buy is giving away three-card fun packs, Bandai Pikachu Model Kits, visors, and stickers for free in Pokémon Trade and Play events.

item.title: Pokémon Winds and Pokémon Waves officially announced for 2027 with three new starter Pokémon, and it's probably going to be a Nintendo Switch 2 exclusive
item.description: The Pokémon Company has announced the next mainline entries in the long-running video game series, Pokémon WindsandPokémon Waves, launching in 2027 for Nintendo Switch 2.

item.title: Compacte, cette batterie externe de 12 000 mAh et 100 W avec deux ports perd 20 % de son prix
item.description: Légère et pratique à transporter, la batterie externe Ugreen Nexode est dotée d'une capacité de 12 000 mAh et d'une puissance de 100 W. De quoi recharger vos appareils plusieurs fois de façon rapide. Actuellement, on la trouve à 39,98 euros au lieu de 49,99 euros sur Amazon.

item.title: Pokémon Winds and Waves are coming to Switch 2 in 2027
item.description: The Pokémon leakers were right: the Gen 10 games are called Pokémon Wind and Pokémon Waves. The Pokémon Company confirmed the titles during a 30th anniversary stream on Pokémon Day. The games are set to hit Nintendo Switch 2 in 2027. (A Game Freak leak last October suggested Wind and Waves would be out this year with DLC to follow in 2027.)According to the Pokémon account on X, in Wind and Waves, “you’ll travel across beautiful windswept islands and a vast ocean with glittering waves that ebb and flow. You’ll also team up with Pokémon to overcome challenges and even the forces of nature!” They...

item.title: Here’s your first look at Kratos in Amazon’s God of War show
item.description: Amazon has slowly been teasing out casting details for its live-action adaptation of God of War, and now we have our first look at the show. It's a single image but a notable one showing protagonist Kratos and his son Atreus. The characters are played by Ryan Hurst and Callum Vinson, respectively, and they look […]

item.title: The Galaxy S26 is a photography nightmare

The S26 lines come with some useful new things - particularly the Privacy Display on the S26 Ultra, which looks like an extremely cool bit of tech and a really useful new feature - and a lot of iterative year-over-year changes. item.title: Fini les problèmes visuels sur la PS5 Pro ? Sony annonce une importante mise à jour
item.description: Après des débuts compliqués, le PSSR de la PS5 Pro tente de se refaire une santé. Sony a dévoilé une nouvelle version de sa technologie d’upscaling, peaufinée avec AMD, et promet enfin une image plus stable et plus précise.

item.title: The Morning After: The Galaxy S26 Ultra’s Privacy Display is pretty cool
item.description: Samsung’s Unpacked event midweek revealed three new phones and two sets of earbuds, but the real standout, as usual, is the Galaxy S26 Ultra. This year, the Ultra actually features a bit of genuine tech innovation — and no, we don’t mean it folds. Let’s talk about its new Privacy Display. This isn't a shimmery, holographic screen protector that’s hard to read and constantly peels off at the corners; this tech is engineered directly into the S26 Ultra’s OLED display. Samsung Display revealed its Flex Magic Pixel technology back in 2024. The S26 Ultra’s Privacy Display is built off the back of t...

item.title: Engadget Podcast: Xbox's leadership shakeup and Samsung's Galaxy S26
item.description: This week, we're diving into the big changes at Xbox and what it all means for Microsoft's gaming future. Phil Spencer, the longtime face of Xbox, announced he's retiring last week. He'll be replaced by Microsoft's former CoreAI CEO Asha Sharma, instead of his longtime deputy Sarah Bond, who plans to leave the company. Will this change actually help the beleaguered Xbox division, or is it another example of Microsoft shoving AI into everything? Also, Samsung held its latest Unpacked event this week to announce its new Galaxy S26 family. They look pretty much the same as last year, but the Ultr...

item.title: 'Today, frontier AI systems are simply not reliable enough to power fully autonomous weapons' — Anthropic CEO on why it won't agree to The Pentagon's scary request
item.description: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei is denying the US Department of War's request to use Claude AI for surveillance and warfare – and this is the best AI news we've heard in a while.

item.title: OpenAI snags $110 billion in investments from Amazon, Nvidia, and Softbank
item.description: OpenAI has closed another round of funding, totalling $110 billion being newly committed to the maker of ChatGPT, which it says has more than 900 million weekly active users and over 50 million consumer subscribers. Amazon is investing $50 billion and striking a deal that includes plans for custom models and more. Nvidia and SoftBank […]

item.title: Perplexity « Computer » : l’IA qui recrute d’autres IA pour faire votre travail à votre place
item.description: Vous rêviez de déléguer la création de votre application ou la gestion d'une campagne marketing à une machine ? Perplexity vient de lancer « Computer », un super-agent capable de découper un projet complexe et de le distribuer à une armée de modèles d'intelligence artificielle pour l'exécuter à votre place.

item.title: 'We see an opportunity to move faster with smaller, highly talented teams using AI to automate more work': Block decimates workforce in favor of AI
item.description: Jack Dorsey's Block will remove 4,000 workers from its 10,000-strong team, all because AI can get the job done for less.

item.title: HBO Max en mars 2025 : voici les films et séries à ne pas manquer (avant que ça parte chez Paramount)
item.description: La vente de Warner Bros. Discovery (et donc de HBO Max) vient de prendre un nouveau tournant, alors il serait peut-être temps de profiter de ces films et séries avant que ça ne parte chez Paramount... ou Netflix.

item.title: Anthropic is refusing to bend on AI safeguards as dispute with Pentagon nears deadline
item.description: CEO Dario Amodei said his company ‘cannot in good conscience accede’ to the Pentagon. A public showdown between the Trump administration and Anthropic is hitting an impasse as military officials demand the artificial intelligence company bend its ethical policies by Friday or risk damaging its business.Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei drew a sharp red line 24 hours before the deadline, declaring his company “cannot in good conscience accede” to the Pentagon’s final demand to allow unrestricted use of its technology.Anthropic, maker of the chatbot Claude, can afford to lose a defense contract. But th...
